page.title: 17Local Legends.
page.content: There are many local legends. One tells how Satan decided he would destroy Shrewsbury Town. He searched until he found some large boulders,he put them into his apron and walked to Stiperstones but when he got there his apron string broke and the boulders fell to the ground. That's how the Devil's Chair came to be there. There was a rider called Wild Edric who used to ride across Stiperstones. It was said that he married a fairy called Godda.It is also said that if anyone sees him and Godda riding along the Stiperstones there is sure to be a war. At Hogstow Hall there is said to be the ghost of William Scarlet who committed murder.The ghost is meant to appear at midnight on the way to Shelve past Pennerley there used to be a gate and if you approach it at midnight it opens automatically.
